news.title: RFK Jr. could further deter childhood vaccinations as rates fall in the U.S.
news.summary: Some health policy experts say Kennedy's early moves as HHS Secretary are concerning and suggest that he could undermine immunizations in less direct ways. Kennedy is expected to be sworn in as Secretary of HHS on Monday.

news.title: China's consumer inflation turns negative for the first time in 13 months
news.summary: The data comes as investors continue to look for signs that Beijing's stimulus measures can help to boost the country's struggling economic recovery. The data comes from the National Bureau of Statistics.

news.title: Top Wall Street analysts are bullish on these dividend stocks
news.summary: TipRanks' analyst ranking service highlights three dividend-paying stocks. Coterra Energy and Walmart are two of them.

news.title: ‘We don’t believe in the velvet rope:' One money manager is giving retail investors access to private credit. But is it worth it?
news.summary: The exchange-traded fund industry is looking to give retail investors more access to alternative investments including private credit. The move is aimed at giving them access to private credit and other alternative investments.

news.title: These accounts can be the 'worst possible asset’ for retirement, expert says. Here's why
news.summary: Many investors don't plan for future taxes when contributing to traditional IRAs. Here are the key things to know about how to contribute to a traditional IRA.

news.title: My husband plans to leave his entire estate to his adult son, who steals his credit card to gamble online. What can I do?
news.summary: "Dementia runs in my husband’s family. My husband�s son has been known to take money from his dad without permission," she said.

news.title: America’s job market is eerily similar to the 1990s dot-com boom — just before the bust
news.summary: March 20 marks the 25th anniversary of the dot-com bust. Could it happen again? CNN's John Sutter looks at the possibility of a repeat.

news.title: Inflation and tariffs might scare shoppers. Have they scared CEOs?
news.summary: Adobe, Oracle and more retailers report during the week. Executives are talking a lot about tariffs, but little about a recession.

news.title: I fled our $2.2M home due to domestic abuse. I’m on the loan, but we’re both on the title. My husband won’t sell. What now?
news.summary: “He contributed a $1 million down payment. I mortgaged the rest in my name,” he says. “He’s a great guy.” “I’m very proud of what I’ve done.’

news.title: I signed a prenup, but my husband refuses to make a will or set up a trust. If he dies, will I inherit his estate?
news.summary: “He has one adult son from whom he is estranged. He is 71 and I am 69,” she said. “He is 71, I is 69.” “I am 71, he is 71. I am 71 and he is 69”
